mods.railcraft.api.tracks

Class TrackSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • mods.railcraft.api.tracks.TrackSpec

  • public final class TrackSpec
extends java.lang.Object
    Each type of Track has a single instance of TrackSpec that corresponds with it. Each Track block in the world has a ITrackInstance that corresponds with it. Take note of the difference (similar to block classes and tile entities classes). TrackSpecs must be registered with the TrackRegistry in either the Pre-Init or Init Phases. Track ItemStacks can be acquired from the TrackSpec, but you are required to register a proper display name yourself (during Post-Init).
    Author:
    CovertJaguar
    See Also:
    TrackRegistry, ITrackInstance

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrackSpec

        public TrackSpec(short trackId,
         java.lang.String tag,
         ITrackItemIconProvider iconProvider,
         java.lang.Class<? extends ITrackInstance> instanceClass)
        Defines a new track spec.
        Parameters:
        trackId - A unique identifier for the track type. 0-512 are reserved for Railcraft. Capped at Short.MAX_VALUE
        tag - A unique internal string identifier (ex. "track.speed.transition")
        iconProvider - The provider for Track item icons
        instanceClass - The ITrackInstance class that corresponds to this TrackSpec
        See Also:
        ITextureProvider

      • TrackSpec

        public TrackSpec(short trackId,
         java.lang.String tag,
         ITrackItemIconProvider iconProvider,
         java.lang.Class<? extends ITrackInstance> instanceClass,
         java.util.List<java.lang.String> tooltip)
        Defines a new track spec.
        Parameters:
        trackId - A unique identifier for the track type. 0-512 are reserved for Railcraft. Capped at Short.MAX_VALUE
        tag - A unique internal string identifier (ex. "track.speed.transition")
        iconProvider - The provider for Track item icons
        instanceClass - The ITrackInstance class that corresponds to this TrackSpec
        tooltip - The tool tip for the Track Item
        See Also:
        ITextureProvider
